snippet: Curators at the Art Institute of Chicago and the Tate Modern in London have spent five years organizing their own retrospective, which opens in Chicago on May 16.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; the Art Institute of Chicago and the Tate Modern in London have organized the first traveling Roy Lichtenstein retrospective in 20 years; the Frick Collection will exhibit a portrait by Vincent van Gogh on loan from the Norton Simon Museum in Pasadena, Calif; the National Gallery of Art in Washington, DC, acquires painting by Simon Hantai; Thomas Seydoux, chairman of Christie's Impressionist and modern art department, resigns.
lead_paragraph: Curators at the Art Institute of Chicago and the Tate Modern in London have spent five years organizing their own retrospective, which opens in Chicago on May 16.

headline.main: A New Traveling Show of Lichtenstein Works
headline.print_headline: A New Traveling Show of Lichtenstein Works
